entry.title: Re: Extension Point for Custom Logic for EWM Outbound Del...
entry.content:
Dear @lockpicking 

In Custom Fields app choose business context below, one for header and second for item

 

After published field, you will be able to add your own field like below (Fiori app Manage Outbound Delivery Orders) in Adapt UI mode: 

 

 

Make the field available to the print form Still in Custom Fields, open your field and enable it for Form Templates / UIs & Reports (data source). If a data source extension is required, follow SAP‚Äôs procedure to extend a form template‚Äôs data source so the custom field appears in the form‚Äôs data connection.

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/87f9b54f9c4f4e75aff0061860a6589a/c70d06ed39f34108b520e85dcc7de0c5.html?utm_source=chatgpt.com

Put the field on the EWM Loading List form Open Maintain Form Templates. For EWM‚Äôs loading list, copy the delivered EWM_LOADING_LIST template (that‚Äôs the one you adapt for the EWM loading instruction/list).

Download the form, open it in Adobe LiveCycle Designer, bind your custom field from the data connection and place it on the layout.

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/87f9b54f9c4f4e75aff0061860a6589a/c70d06ed39f34108b520e85dcc7de0c5.html?utm_source=chatgpt.com

 

Best Regards,

Dawid

entry.content:

  • Scavenger Hunt main Blog post : https://community.sap.com/t5/devtoberfest-blog-posts/fun-for-week-1-the-devtoberfest-scavenger-hunt/ba-p/14183972

  • Release highlights: https://www.linkedin.com/posts/thomashammersap_saphanacloud-innovation-clouddata-activity-7376676583241195520-5nz6/

  • üîµ Leveraging Calculation Views in SAP BAS: an Introduction: https://community.sap.com/t5/devtoberfest/leveraging-calculation-views-in-sap-bas-an-introduction/ec-p/14208844#M1081 
  • üîµ Developing AI-driven SAP HANA Cloud applications with SAP Business Application Studio and Joule: https://community.sap.com/t5/devtoberfest/developing-ai-driven-sap-hana-cloud-applications-with-sap-business/ev-p/14220020

  • Blog Post: https://community.sap.com/t5/sap-teched-blog-posts/call-for-community-talk-speakers-step-into-the-spotlight-at-sap-teched-on/ba-p/14226945

  • Call for Proposals: https://openui5.org/ui5con/bengaluru2025/index.html 
  • SAPUI5 Road Map Explorer: https://roadmaps.sap.com/board?PRODUCT=73554900100800001361&range=CURRENT-LAST#Q4%202025 

 

CHAPTER TITLES  

0:00 Intro 

0:10 Devtoberfest Week 2 
 
0:31 Petoberfest  

1:48 reCAP 2025 Yellow Room Track (Audimax) sessions now on YouTube 

2:37 Scavenger Hunt Clue #4 

4:03 What‚Äôs New in SAP HANA Cloud ‚Äì 2025/Q3 

5:36 Call for Community Talk Speakers SAP TechEd on Tour Bangalore 2025 

6:40 UI5con 2025 Bangalore Call for Proposals & SAPUI5 Road Map Explorer 

 

TRANSCRIPTION

[Intro] This is the SAP Developer News for October 2nd, 2025.

[Kevin] Hey everyone, week one of Devtoberfest is almost over. If you want to check out what activities we've planned for week two, head over to the community, to the Devtoberfest group, and look out for the blog post, Devtoberfest, week two activities. See you there.

[Daniel] I'm here with Pepper, a flat coat retriever, to announce Petoberfest, where you can upload a picture of your pet, or your favorite zoo creature, or stuffed animal, or any furry friend you fancy. Just upload the picture as a comment to my blog post. In addition, use that picture as the basis for an AI-generated image of your pet. For example, hybris Pepper helping me with my Devtoberfest crosswords and wearing her favorite hat. Be creative both in the setup and the style. Petoberfest this year coincides with World Animal Day, so you can also upload a picture of yourself taking part in any animal welfare project. For example, renovating a straight cat hotel or walking to raise money for your local ASPCA. if you upload a picture you will win oodles of points for the devtoberfest grand prize so i'm looking forward to seeing a picture of your pet good news for all you cat fans the rest of the session

[DJ] recordings from recap 2025 are now online on youtube for your queuing and viewing pleasure now we already had the recordings of the sessions from the blue room track on the recap on conference youtube channel and now after getting hold of the recording from the audimax theater we've got the sessions from the yellow room track cut and organized into individual videos and they're in a playlist for you as well the playlist follows the agenda order. And yes, we processed everything with a little bash script and everything on the command line. The future really is terminal.

[Shrini] The scavenger hunt event runs across multiple weeks of Devtoberfest. I hope you already figured out the three clues we gave out and you have a 12-digit hexadecimal number with you. If not, you may pause this video and check out the clues we released earlier from the main blog post on the scavenger end and come back for the fourth clue. For the fourth clue we can explore some github repositories as the clue is hidden in one of the repositories. Many of you may be aware of the SAP GitHub org SAP samples. It contains sample code, TechEd tutorials, Code Jam material and hundreds of reports from which you can learn about ABAP, CAP, BUILD, and other SAP-related technology. Among the various repos, take a closer look at the SAP BTP AI Best Practices repo to find the two-character clue. This repo contains best practices, sample implementations, to build AI-powered applications and serves as a practical guide for developers looking to implement enterprise-grade AI solutions using SAP AI services and integration with generative AI models. To find the clue number four, you don't have to clone the repo. You can look around the repo, access various tabs, search within the repo for some common terms related to desktop office like build, ABAP, CAP, AI, etc. Happy hunting!

[Witalij] Before we dive in, a quick note. Our cat Felicia decided it was the perfect time for an app, so she's not joining today. But I'm here and there is plenty to share. We've just released the third SAP HANA Cloud update of 2025, packed with meaningful advancements. Here are a few highlights I've personally chosen. Vector embedding SQL functions now supports the generative AI hub, helping you integrate different models more easily. JSON is now a native data type in the document store, simplifying work with the unstructured data. Single sign-on for data lake files enhances security and accessibility. And with drill in SAP build code, you can generate SQL from natural language, making development faster and more intuitive, and you can feel like a wipe coder now. For all the details, check out the dedicated blog post or the product team's teaser video. If data modeling is your focus. Don't miss Jan Zwickal's deep-dive post on the latest in graphical view modeling. He also spoke at Devtoberfest this week. Recordings are already available, if you missed it. Finally, mark your calendar for next Thursday as well, as Christoph Morgan will explore developing AI-driven SAP HANA Cloud applications live at Devtoberfest. It's a great chance to see these features in action? Let us know what stands out to you.

[Tom] If you're in the India region, we've got an interesting opportunity for you to join the SAP TechEd On Tour in Bangalore coming up at the end of November. The community talk call for speakers is now open. If you're interested in sharing your experience or your knowledge about a particular topic in the SAP Space, this is your opportunity to get a free lecture only ticket to the SAP TechEd on Tour taking place in Bangalore. You only have until October 10th to submit your session proposal, so be sure to act quickly. We look forward to seeing you at TechEd Berlin as most of the developer advocates team will be there. We'll be cheering you on and helping mentor you for your presentation as well. So this is a great opportunity for anybody looking to get a ticket to TechEd on Tour Bangalore and to share their knowledge at the event. So look forward to seeing you there.

[Nico] Hi everyone and welcome to the developer news. Your 5-card 2025 in Bangalore is going to happen in December and the call for proposals is now open. You can submit your session proposal until October 31st. There is quickfire presentations, around 20 minutes long, in-depth sessions, 40 minutes, or longer hands-on workshops. Definitely check that out if you want to have a session at UI5Con in Bangalore. Also related to UI5, there is a new version of the SAP UI5 RoadMavic store with some interesting items on there regarding AI, obviously. There is new AI related controls and also interesting MCP items. So definitely check that one out if you are interested in SAPUI5. All right, hope to talk to you soon. Bye.

entry.title: Re: Unable to Edit Project Scope ‚Äì "Edit Project Scope" O...
entry.content:
Dear Customer,

I hope you are well.

I can see as per screenshot that change project is in status "Closed".
You are not able to edit the scope once project has been closed.

In order to edit the scope, you need to create a copy solution profile from production to test tenant, edit the scope in test tenant and test the features changed, once it is done, you need to merge the project and activate its solution capabilities to the changed reflects in the productive tenant.

1922087- How to Create a Change Project and Its Lifecycle
https://me.sap.com/notes/1922087

In case you have any further questions or issues, please reach out to me and I'll be glad to help. 

Have a great day!  

Best regards, 

Tiago 
SAP Technical Support

entry.title: Production order scheduling issue
entry.content:
We are using basic scheduling with backward scheduling enabled, and the production scheduling profile has the indicator checked for "scheduling upon release of order." The material is set up with 6 days of in-house manufacturing time.

When MRP runs and creates a planned order, the system correctly considers the 6 working days specified in the material master's In-house field. For example, if the end date is calculated as 10/10/2025, MRP sets the start date 6 working days before that.

However, when we convert the planned order into a production order, the system does not consider the 6 working days. Instead, it sets both the start date and end date as 10/10/2025 (start date same as the end date), rather than calculating the start date as 6 days earlier.

entry.title: Why is BOM Header Not Transferred to Project in Auto BOM Transfer (VC / PS Integration)?
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We are working with a Project System + Variant Configuration (VC) scenario.

‚Ä¢ In the sales order, the item material is the BOM header (configured material).

‚Ä¢ During automatic BOM transfer to the project from Order BOM, only the components are  transferred into the project/WBS/network ‚Äî the BOM header itself is not transferred(SO Item Material).

‚Ä¢ We ran MRP and able to create Planed order for sub components but not for the header. The business team now wants to be able to create a production order for the BOM header directly from the project as it is a Finished Good.

‚Ä¢ Their concern is: if the BOM header is only produced via sales order ‚Üí PP , why do we need PS at all?

My questions are:

1. Is it standard SAP behavior that auto BOM transfer into PS only brings in components, not the BOM header? If so, how do I create Prod order for Order BOM header. 

2. If yes, what is the standard process to handle production of the BOM header material in a PS + VC integration scenario?

3. Is there any way (config or enhancement) to also transfer the BOM header into the project so that production order creation can happen from PS?Because it‚Äôs not making sense to me with components requirement generated from PS without the header.

entry.title: Re: Why asset doest not have material code in SAP ERP?
entry.content:
Hello @nithin_pranesh 

In S/4HANA Public Cloud (scope item J62), the system creates the asset automatically at PO creation, not at GR. This is standard design; there is no option to shift creation to GR. If you need that behaviour, it will require a Customer Influence request.

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Why asset doest not have material code in SAP ERP?
entry.content:
Hello @nithin_pranesh 

In S/4HANA Public Cloud, migrating BUT000 Business Partner) Texts are not directly supported through the standard Migration Cockpit. Here's what you can do.

Migration Cockpit: Verify if there are any specific templates for Business Partner texts. If none are available, you will need to consider custom solutions.s.

APIs: Utilise OData or REST APIs for Business Partner data migration. Check for BUPA_TEXT_CREATE or similar endpoints for texts.

Fiori Apps: utilise the "Manage Business Partner Master Data" app for bulk data maintenance, which may involve manually adding or editing business partner texts.

Custom Solution: If APIs and Fiori apps don't meet your needs, develop a custom migration script to upload texts via APIs or batch processing.

If it's a significant migration, collaborating with SAP support or an integration partner might be beneficial.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Class for each equipment or product cannot be assigne...
entry.content:
Hello @Simon_Lehnert 

You‚Äôre using SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and facing a common issue: mass-updating class or characteristic assignments after migration. Let me explain it step by step.

Current Situation

Products (Product and product Master): 3,000 migrated, with no class or characteristic assignments.

Equipment (Plant Maintenance / Asset Management): approximately 30,000 migrated, also without class/characteristic assignments.

Classification system: Classes and characteristics have already been migrated to Type 300, Brand 400, Model 3,000

Issue: Migration Cockpit Migrate Your Data lacks fields for classification values within product/equipment templates. There is no mass change application available for classification.

Note:

 In the Public Cloud, migration templates cover only the core master data, Product and Equipment.

Classification values are managed in separate object tables, such as AUSP, KSSK, and INOB and are not embedded in Product/Equipment templates.

Options in Public Cloud

Migration Object Classification

SAP Help Portal ‚Äì Migrate Your Data with Migration Cockpit (F3473)

Data Migration via APIs

For Products: API_CLFN_CLASSIFICATION_SRV-Class Data for Classification

For Equipment: API_EQUIPMENT_CLASSIFICATION_SRV

Workaround with Custom Fields
Use CFL if only reporting/search is needed. SAP Help-Custom Fields App and Custom Logic App

Best Practice: Use the Classification migration object for initial load; use the APIs for ongoing updates.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: 5C Framework for SAP Integrated Business Planning Data Validation Strategy
entry.content:
@Luis2, To answer your question, there are few aspects like Table 1, Figure 3 and Figure 4 must be considered which master data design. Figure 5 can be implemented after that while planning level configuration. Figure 6 : Network Checks can be implemented based on the discretion of the solution complexity and options available. My paradigm would be to use whatever is available in the IBP system rather than ABAP, CIDS, CI or RTI BApis. IBP Master data rules come handy to validate the network. Figure 7 and Figure 8 can be used in conjunction, to ensure that all the modules in scope has their relevant data. 

Figure 9 is part of the data flow scheduling (sequence, frequency, Real-Time or Batch mode, Full or Delta mode)

Hope this answers your question.

entry.title: Reducing Cart Abandonment with SAP Commerce Cloud
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

Imagine that a customer adds items to their cart. They‚Äôre ready to check out, but something feels off. The steps take too long, the information isn‚Äôt clear, or support isn‚Äôt available when it‚Äôs needed. Within seconds, the cart is abandoned.

It‚Äôs a familiar story, and it signals more than just a lost sale. It shows that the experience didn‚Äôt meet expectations.

That‚Äôs why we created a new Value Package to Improve Customer Satisfaction by reducing Cart Abandonment Rate, focused on reducing cart abandonment and improving customer satisfaction.

 

Why it matters

Cart abandonment and satisfaction aren‚Äôt separate issues. They‚Äôre connected. When checkout is simple, fast, and supported, customers don‚Äôt just complete purchases, they leave with a positive impression of your brand.

You can see how this plays out in our teaser video, which highlights how SAP Commerce Cloud helps remove friction, respond to user behavior, and deliver support when it matters most.

üé•Watch the teaser video

 

What‚Äôs inside the Value Package

The Value Package brings together practical resources and configuration guidance across the key areas that shape the checkout experience:

  • Cart and Checkout Optimization ‚Äì adapt paths to each user‚Äôs context
  • Adaptive Search ‚Äì make product discovery quick and intuitive
  • Product Content Management ‚Äì ensure clarity and consistency in product data
  • Promotions and Campaigns ‚Äì add relevant offers that drive action
  • Voice of the Customer ‚Äì capture feedback, even from incomplete sessions
  • Real-Time Support Tools ‚Äì provide guidance before users give up

üëâExplore the Value Package for SAP Commerce Cloud

Note: Access to this asset requires a one-time registration to SAP Learning Hub, edition for SAP Enterprise Support.  üìå Sign up | Walkthrough video  

 

A path forward

When you connect satisfaction with reduced abandonment, you see measurable results: more completed purchases, fewer frustrations, and stronger loyalty. Teams also gain clearer insight into what works and where improvements are needed.

Beyond reducing cart abandonment, SAP Enterprise Support offers additional resources to help you drive innovation. SAP Enterprise Support Value Maps provide expert-led resources, tailored recommendations, and advisory services‚Äîall included in your SAP cloud subscription. Get started today:  ‚≠ê Access SAP Enterprise Support Value Maps Group for personalized guidance and subscribe to the CX Value Map

With 12 years of experience at SAP and a background spanning roles in various customer support positions, Edmar is passionate about helping customers succeed through SAP Enterprise Support offerings.

entry.title: Re: Why HU_label is printed even though HU Step is set to...
entry.content:
Hi @ST24 

Thank you for your question.

Consult Output Management for Warehouse Order Documents & Output Parameter Determination for more details.

To summarise, the HU label printing for pick-Hus is controlled through BRF+ Output Parameter Determination in public cloud. By default, SAP delivers an active rule with dispatch time = immediate for HU_LABEL, which is why your labels are printing automatically even though you defined custom determination rule.

You can resolve this by reviewing the HU output determination rules in the Output Parameter Determination app √† Application = Warehouse Management, Object Type = Handling Unit. Either deactivate or adopt the delivered HU_LABEL rule or change the dispatch time to Manual or Scheduled if you do not want labels to print automatically when HU is created.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Regarding the Logic of Custom Business Objects
entry.content:
Hello @yukitsumura 

Thank you for your question.

Consult Custom Business Objects, Extensibility Options & Custom Business Objects, Fields, and Logic  for more details.

The easiest way to restrict a custom field on Business Partner master data to valid valued from a custom Business Object is to define the CBO as the value help for that field in the Custom Fields and Logic app. This ensures users can only select from predefined entries during BP registration.

However, if you also need to block invalid values entered through APIs or mass upload, you must add a validation BAdI in the Business Partner business context. E.g. BUSINESSPARTNER_CHECK. In this logic, compare the custom field value with your CBO entries and raise an error if it does not exist. This will provide full enforcement beyond the UI.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Success Factor ecp to S4H Public Cloud Integration
entry.content:
Good day @GAK1 

Thank you for your question.

Please note that only one controlling area (A000) is permitted in public cloud. If Employee Central Payroll has multiple controlling areas such as 1000,2000,3000, you cannot replicate them directly into S/4H. The standard approach is to use value mapping during replication: either in the Business Integration Builder framework or in SAP Cloud Integration. There you can map all ECP controlling areas to the single controlling area A000 in S/4H. This way, all validations in S/4H will succeed, while ECP can still maintain its multiple areas.

Consult Business Integration Builder (BIB) Knowledge & Maintain the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Value Mapping for more details.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Cannot edit Bookpage
entry.content:
Hi Sanchia,

The Book Page has been incorrectly created, your Start Page is an actual Book Page template, not a Book Page created with reference to a Book Page template.  You should have a Book Page template that contains all of the common information that you expect to appear on Book Pages created from that template.  So, you should have a Book Page template for the Start Page and a second template for the End Page.

Once you have to two templates, which contain the common objects expected on those corresponding pages, e.g. a Logo, you can then use those templates to create Book Page.  To do that:

1. Click on the Simulation object
2. Click the yellow plus icon on the toolbar to create a new object
3. Select the Book Page object
4. Give the Book Page a name and make sure that the template field contains the template to be used for this page, e.g. the Start Page template
5. Click OK.

Please look at this video to understand more about create Book Page templates and Book Pages from those templates.

Regards
Shane

entry.title: Re: Rejection EDocument Cockpit
entry.content:
Hello @Jessicaaguilar1 

Thank you for your question.

The reject error you received occurs because the field NumSerieFacturaEmisor must follow AEAT‚ÄôS specific format for complementary customs settlement invoices which is D7. In Spain, this number must reference the original customs settlement with a complementary suffix, e.g. 2023ES123456/01. If you use a standard invoice number format, AEAT will reject it.

Please check that in your SAP configuration, the reference Code mentioned earlier is filled with the DUA number in the correct format.

Consult SII tip for Spain #2: Reuse <NumSerieFacturaEmisor> in case of de-registered invoices, AEAT Certificates for SII ‚Äî Spain & 2872857 - eDocument Spain Troubleshooting Guide for more details.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Authentication Failed
entry.content:
Hi Sanchia,

If you can see the Workspace in your Workspace list in Manager, and have Administrator access, you should be able to open the Workspace.  Access to Workspaces is not only controlled by the User Role (Administrators in your case) - which defines the User Permissions that your account can access - but also by Workspace Permissions.  In Manager, open the Administration > Workspaces and Tags menu and click the Manage Access link beside the Workspace.  Your User Role should be listed and when you select it you should have the ability to Administer the Workspace.  Other Roles, such as Master Authors, should only have access to the level of Create, Edit and View content and Learners should only be able to View Published Content. 

So, Workspace Permissions also must be considered.  However, the fact that you can see the Workspace in your Workspace list means that you should be able to open it.  Given this, I would raise a support ticket using Component ID KM-SEN-MGR and get support to identify the problem because I suspect that it's an issue with SSO.

Regards
Shane

entry.content: Hello,

entry.title: Re: using hdbsql in shell script and query database
entry.content:
Hello,
I was able to reproduce the issue on a local test system.
I got around it by simplifying the hdbsql command as follows:


HDBBACKUPTEST=$(sudo su - "$HDBSIDADM" -c 'hdbsql -U HDBUSERSTOREKEY " select * from "SYS"."M_BACKUP_CATALOG" " ' )

In the example above I took out the ";" which I assumed was causing the command to get broken.  I see that the original command was trying to use \c and ; for multiline mode, but I'm not sure that you need that.

If you need to embed a more complex hdbsql command, I'd suggest embedding the command into its own environment variable using a heredoc, similar to this:

HDBSQL_CMD=$(cat <<'EOSQL'
hdbsql -U HDBUSERSTOREKEY "select \* from \"SYS\".\"M_BACKUP_CATALOG\""
EOSQL
)

That may help you avoid issues with the quoting later on.

I hope this helps,
Kind regards,
Dan

entry.title: RAP Using Custom Entity with load multiple data using Pagination and Preview using UI annotations
entry.content:
This blog covers RAP development using a custom entity, showcasing data with UI annotations, and surpassing the standard SAP data preview limit through the use of pagination.

Lets Start....

Step 1: Create a custom entity with the fields that need to be displayed or sent to the frontend.

@EndUserText.label: 'Custom entity for fetching data'
@ObjectModel.query.implementedBy: 'ABAP:ZCL_IMPLEMENT_EXT' //This is the class where the data is handle and processed
@UI:{ headerInfo:{  typeName: 'RAP Learn',
                             typeNamePlural: 'RAP Learn',
                             title: { label: 'RAP Learn',
                                       type: #STANDARD,
                                       value: 'component'
                                     },
                             description: { value: 'obj_desc' },
                                     typeImageUrl: 'sap-icon://activity-items' //Show Icon image on header of object layout
                           }
               }
@Search.searchable: true //for Searching the data from the output which is also need to implement in the implemented class above 
define root custom entity ZCE_MAIN
{
      @ui.facet   : [{
                      id: 'ID1',
                      purpose: #STANDARD,
                      type: #IDENTIFICATION_REFERENCE,
                      label : 'Component detail',
                      position: 10
                    },
                    {
                id: 'FG1',
                purpose: #STANDARD,
                type: #FIELDGROUP_REFERENCE,
                label : 'Validity Date',
                targetQualifier: 'FG1',
                position: 10
              }]
      @ui         : {  selectionField: [{ position: 10 }]}
      @Consumption.filter.mandatory: true
      @Consumption.valueHelpDefinition: [{
                            entity : { name: 'ZIV_F4MATNR' , element: 'matnr'   } ,
                            additionalBinding: [{ localElement: 'werks', element: 'werks' },
                                                         {  localElement: 'stlan' , element: 'stlan' },
                                                         {  localElement: 'stlal' , element: 'stlal' }]}]
      @Consumption.filter.selectionType: #SINGLE
  key matnr       : matnr;
      @ui         : {  selectionField: [{ position: 20 }]}
      @Consumption.filter.mandatory: true
      @Consumption.valueHelpDefinition: [{
                      entity : { name: 'ZIV_F4WERKS', element: 'werks' }
                                                         }]
      @Consumption.filter.selectionType: #SINGLE
  key werks       : werks_d;
      @ui         : {  selectionField: [{ position: 30 }]}
      @Consumption.filter.mandatory: true
      @Consumption.valueHelpDefinition: [{
                entity : { name: 'ZIV_F4STLAN' , element: 'stlan' }
                                                   }]
      @Consumption.filter.selectionType: #SINGLE
  key stlan       : stlan;
      @ui         : {  selectionField: [{ position: 40 }]}
      @Consumption.filter.mandatory: true
      @Consumption.filter.selectionType: #SINGLE
  key stlal       : stlal;
      @ui         : { lineItem: [{ position: 10 }], identification: [{ position: 10 }]}
      @EndUserText.label: 'Level'
  key bom_level   : abap.dec( 2, 0 );
      @ui         : { lineItem: [{ position: 20 }], identification: [{ position: 20 }]}
      @EndUserText.label: 'Component'
      @search.defaultSearchElement: true
  key component   : idnrk;
      @ui         : {  selectionField: [{ position: 50 }]}
      @Consumption.filter.mandatory: true
      @Consumption.filter.selectionType: #SINGLE
      @EndUserText.label: 'Date'
      zdate       : abap.dats;
      @ui         : { lineItem: [{ position: 30, cssDefault: { width: '13rem' }  }], identification: [{ position: 30 }]}
      @EndUserText.label: 'Object Description'
      @search.defaultSearchElement: true
      obj_desc    : maktx;
      @ui         : { lineItem: [{ position: 35, cssDefault: { width: '8rem' } }], identification: [{ position: 35 }]}
      @EndUserText.label: 'Quantity'
      comp_qty    : kmpmg_bi;
      @ui         : { lineItem: [{ position: 45 }], identification: [{ position: 45 }]}
      @EndUserText.label: 'Unit'
      comp_unit   : kmpme;
      @ui         : { lineItem: [{ position: 55 }], fieldGroup: [{ position: 10 , qualifier: 'FG1', label: 'Valid From' }]}
      @EndUserText.label: 'Valid from'
      valid_from  : datuv_bi;
      @ui         : { lineItem: [{ position: 65 }], fieldGroup: [{ position: 11 , qualifier: 'FG1', label: 'Valid To' }]}
      @EndUserText.label: 'Valid to'
      valid_to    : datub_bi;
}


While using the RAP framework, metadata extensions cannot be created for custom entities. Therefore, annotations must be directly included in the custom entity code itself for UI purposes.

Step 2 : Create an implementation class for the custom entity mentioned above and name it ZCL_IMPLEMENT_EXT or use the custom name specified in the second line of the code.

CLASS zcl_implement_ext DEFINITION
  PUBLIC
  FINAL
  CREATE PUBLIC
  SHARED MEMORY ENABLED .

  PUBLIC SECTION.
    DATA : et_final TYPE TABLE OF zce_main.
    INTERFACES if_rap_query_provider .

  PROTECTED SECTION.
  PRIVATE SECTION.

ENDCLASS.



CLASS ZCL_IMPLEMENT_EXT IMPLEMENTATION.

  METHOD if_rap_query_provider~select.
    CASE io_request->get_entity_id( ).
      WHEN 'ZCE_MAIN'.
        TRY.
            DATA(lv_skip) = io_request->get_paging( )->get_offset( ). "gets the skip part from URL which means number of data to be skipped and default is 0 but later on it gets add by 20... till last data not get fetched
            DATA(lv_top) = io_request->get_paging( )->get_page_size( ). "gets the top part from URL which means number of data required and default is 20
            DATA(lt_filter) = io_request->get_filter( )->get_as_ranges( ). "gets the input value which is either pass in our filters or when click on single data line item
           
          CATCH cx_rap_query_filter_no_range.
            "handle exception
        ENDTRY.

        IF lv_top < 0.
*********** Start Logic
"Put logic for single data fetch in which it will trigger when you are going for object page while clicking on single item from display table
"Take inputs from LT_filter table for sending that particular data click 
*********** End Logic
            IF io_request->is_total_numb_of_rec_requested( ).
              io_response->set_total_number_of_records( lines( et_final ) ).
            ENDIF.
            IF io_request->is_data_requested(  ).
              io_response->set_data( et_final ).
            ENDIF.
        ELSE.
*********** Start Logic
"Put logic for actual multiple data fetch in which it will trigger when you click go button or any sort of actions like search, sort, excel download....
"Take inputs from LT_filter table for required data fetch 
*********** End Logic
          ENDIF.
********** Searching Logic
        DATA(lv_search) = io_request->get_search_expression( ). "gets the value from Search field in the UI
          IF lv_search IS NOT INITIAL.
            DATA lt_search LIKE et_final.

            lv_search = |*{ lv_search }*|.
            lt_search = VALUE #( BASE lt_finalts
                          FOR ls_f IN et_final
                          WHERE ( field1 CP lv_search OR  "Put required field to be search instead of field1,field2.....
                                  field2 CP lv_search  OR
                                  field3 cp lv_search OR
                                  field4 cp lv_search OR                                                                
                                                       ( ls_f ) ).
            et_final = lt_search.
          ENDIF.
***********End of Searching logic
***********Sorting logic
        DATA(lt_sort_elements) = io_request->get_sort_elements( ). "gets the detail table of ascending and descending of field we wants to be sorted from UI
          IF lt_sort_elements IS NOT INITIAL.
            LOOP AT lt_sort_elements INTO DATA(ls_sort).
              IF ls_sort-descending <> 'X'.
                SORT et_final BY (ls_sort-element_name) ASCENDING.
              ELSE.
                SORT et_final BY (ls_sort-element_name) DESCENDING.
              ENDIF.
            ENDLOOP.
          ENDIF.
**********End of sorting logic
**********Paging- logic for loading more data wrt Standard set amount of data
          IF lv_top IS NOT INITIAL OR lv_skip IS NOT INITIAL.
            /iwbep/cl_mgw_data_util=>paging( EXPORTING is_paging = VALUE #( top  = lv_top
                                                                            skip = lv_skip )
                                             CHANGING  ct_data   = et_final ).
          ENDIF.
*********End of Pagination

          IF io_request->is_total_numb_of_rec_requested( ).
            io_response->set_total_number_of_records( lines( et_final ) ). "set number of initial data to display overall
          ENDIF.

          IF io_request->is_data_requested(  ).
            io_response->set_data( et_final ). "Set data into the entity
          ENDIF.

        ENDIF.
    ENDCASE.
  ENDMETHOD.

ENDCLASS.


The aforementioned class plays a crucial role as it encapsulates the entire logic for data processing, including searching, sorting, and most importantly, setting data for our custom entity.

Step 3 : Create Service Definition of the Custom entity 

To create a service definition, simply right-click the custom entity in the Project Explorer, click 'New Service Definition', fill in the required inputs, and your service definition will be created.

@EndUserText.label: 'Service definition'
define service ZSD_MAIN {
  expose ZCE_MAIN;
  expose ZIV_F4MATNR; "This is for ValueHelp Definition, and it's okay not to expose it.
  expose ZIV_F4WERKS;
  expose ZIV_F4STLAN;
}


Let's take a look at one of the interface views of the ValueHelpDefinition.

@AbapCatalog.viewEnhancementCategory: [#NONE]
@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
@EndUserText.label: 'Interface view for ValueHelpDefinition - MATNR'
@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: true
@ObjectModel.usageType:{
    serviceQuality: #X,
    sizeCategory: #S,
    dataClass: #MIXED
}
define view entity ZIV_F4MATNR
  as select distinct from mast
    left outer join       makt on makt.matnr = mast.matnr
{
      @ui   : {  selectionField: [{ position: 10 }] , lineItem: [{ position: 10 }]}
      @EndUserText.label: 'Material No'
  key mast.matnr,
      @Consumption.filter.hidden: true
  key mast.werks,
      @Consumption.filter.hidden: true
  key mast.stlan,
      @Consumption.filter.hidden: true
  key mast.stlal,
      @Consumption.filter.hidden: true
      @ui   : {   lineItem: [{ position: 20 }]}
      @EndUserText.label: 'Material Desc'
      makt.maktx
}


Step 4 : Create a Service Binding for the aforementioned service definition.

To create a service binding, simply right-click the created service definition in the Project Explorer, click 'New Service Binding', fill in the required inputs, and your service binding will be created. While creating the Service Binding, I selected OData V2 - UI. Then, activate and publish the service. To view the UI output, you can use the Preview option in Eclipse to see the output as shown in the image below.

 

In conclusion, using RAP with custom entities and pagination facilitates efficient data handling. With UI annotations, you can easily preview and refine the user interface. We hope this guide has been helpful. Stay tuned for more tips!

 

Note: This program is created for a remote system. For cloud environments, you can use a service consumption model or access data through a remote system API in the implementation class.

entry.title: Basic Configurations for SAP EWM Material Flow System: Part-1
entry.content:
Hello there, Thanks for taking your time to visit the blog. I shall be covering basic configurations/settings for enabling SAP EWM Material Flow Systems in SAP EWM.

Please note that unlike other EWM configurations, all the following configurations may not be the 'base' for you all, you might not need everything based on your business requirements. I have tried to explain every configuration node possible so that readers will get an overall idea on MFS configurations. Please make use of them as per your design requirements.

MFS node consists of the following customizing's, Assuming we have a basic warehouse customizing set-up, Lets begin:

Master Data: Extended Warehouse Management> Material Flow systems> Master Data> Define PLC:

Defining the PLC:
PLC (Programmable Logic Controller) can be defined as an industrial computer which can work 24/7. The primary method for automation between SAP EWM and Automated system is via PLC. 
While we set-up customizing and write technical logic from SAP side, PLC vendor or team has to set up the same in their system- They primarily use ladder logic program to code/configure the logic.

The fields which are not explained in above image is self-explanatory, Opening Performance assistance shall be helping you to get the context.

Communication Channel:
Extended Warehouse Management> Material Flow systems> Master Data> Communication Channel:
Define Communication channel:
Communication Channel is the enabler for PLCs, We define the channels and further definitions come under communication channels. There can be multiple channels for a warehouse/PLC for better load balancing.
Note: There are further set-up under easy access for Communication channels, which enables connectivity with the PLC. Those will be covered under next blog.

Assign Communication Channel to Objects:
Extended Warehouse Management> Material Flow systems> Master Data> Communication Channel to Objects:
This is used in case you are defining multiple communication channel for one PLC. In our case, We are just using a single Communication channel.

Define Communication Point types:
Extended Warehouse Management> Material Flow systems> Master Data> Communication Point Types:

Here, We define the communication types of Communication points, for eg:
1. IP- Identification point: This is where the boxes/pallets arrive and they are scanned by the PLC scanner.

Define Communication Points:
Extended Warehouse Management> Material Flow systems> Master Data> Communication Point:

Communication points are each 'Points' defined at automated areas. It can be a scanning point, intermediate point, end point or whatever business needs it to be. Communication points are assigned to Storage Bins in EWM. 
Fields and details:

Communication points are linked to Bins in Easy access> EWM> Master Data> MFS> Maintain Communication Points.

 

You may also group different communication points together and group them using the "Define communication point Groups" node.

Conveyor segment:
Extended Warehouse Management> Material Flow systems> Master Data>  Define Conveyor Segment:

You may define the segments between two Communication Points and define the capacity for the same here. That is, capacity where number of HUs that can be transported between two segments.

Grouping of segments are also possible under customizing.

Define MFS Queue:
Extended Warehouse Management> Material Flow systems> Master Data> Define MFS Queue:

For Material Flow systems, The telegram message sending to PLC control is at Queue level. For any relevant MFS process, We must chose "MFS" relevant queues, Telegram messages are triggered to subsystem based on this.

Define MFS Resource Type:

Extended Warehouse Management> Material Flow systems> Master Data> Define MFS Resource Type:

You define resource types for all vehicles whose movements are controlled order-by-order by the material flow system under this node.  Eg: Crane, AGV, Robotic hands- All these are defined as different resources within the MFS.

There are several WT confirmation levels possible here based on the level of control you need:

  • One-Step Confirmation:
    The system creates the warehouse task and fills the Source Bin, Destination Bin, and Executing Resource fields.
    It sends a telegram that contains the source bin as the source, and a destination bin as a destination.
    The PLC sends an execution confirmation that the handling unit (HU) has been stored in the destination.
    The warehouse task is confirmed.
  • Two-Step Confirmation:
    The system creates the warehouse task and fills the Source Bin, Destination Bin, and Executing Resource fields. It sends a telegram that contains the source bin as the source, and the destination bin as a destination.
    The PLC sends an execution confirmation that the HU was included in the resource.
    The PLC sends an execution confirmation that the HU has been stored in the destination.
    The warehouse task is confirmed.
  • Two-Step Commissioning:
    The system creates the warehouse task and fills the Source Bin, Destination Bin, and Executing Resource fields.
    It sends a telegram that contains the source bin as the source and a resource.
    The PLC sends an execution confirmation that the HU was included in the resource.
    The warehouse task is confirmed and the subsequent warehouse task is created with a filled destination bin and filled source resource.
    A telegram is sent, which has the destination bin as its destination and a resource.

You may also enable interleaving for resources here. Eg: to avoid any Vehicles return without any goods.

Define Aisles and Levels Accessible by Communication points:

Extended Warehouse Management> Material Flow systems> Master Data>  Define Aisles and Levels accessible by Communication Points:
The functionality is self explanatory: If you maintain entries for your communication point and maintain the aisles or bins, It enables the Aisles and levels which can be accessible by the CPs. please note that this configuration is used when you use Case conveyor systems.

To understand the difference between different systems under MFS, Please refer to my previous blog: 
SAP EWM MFS: Pallet, Case conveyor systems 

Making use of Multi-depth bins for storage in ASRS:

Extended Warehouse Management> Material Flow systems> Master Data>  Define required bin depth for HU types/Storage bin types:

Multi-depth bins storage and usage based on HU, storage bin parameters or dimensions can be configured under the below nodes. You may maintain the required depth for the HU or Maximum depth for the bins here.
Also, additionally- If you need to assign x,y,z coordinates- you may assign a communication point to a storage bin in EWM and maintain the coordinates at bin level.

Storage Control:
The storage control level node consists of LOSC configurations, Which I do no intend to cover here since LOSC configurations, testing documents are available online.

Rest of the settings shall be covered in next blog.

Thank you,
Aman Orchard.
